body.p:
Cadiz Ky
17 Aug 1861
Hon B McGoffin
Dear Sir

I herewith forward you a properly authenticated copy of an indictment on the dockett of this court against Kinchen Battoe, who is believed to be in Tennessee. He is a noted forger who raised some eight or ten thousand dollars onf the Bank in this part of Ky, by forging the names of his own father & others and fled the country about four years ago. My information ^is he can^ be can be obtained if a requisition is obtained from the Executive of Tennessee and Mr Wm Durrett is appointed to Execute the warrant of Governor of Tennessee. Mr Durrett is a gentleman of firmness, prudence, humanity and honor and be a most suitable person to appoint, if the Governor will make a special officer which is some times done in such cases.
please have the Documents when obtained addressed to me at this place.

Respectfully yr friend
C. D. Bradley

N, B,
Mr Battoe should be brought to justice and the appointment of Capt. Durrett would be an excellent one Very truly &c

Tennessee
Requisition for Kinchen Battoe
Forgery
Issd Aug 20. 1861
